Description: Pottery Tell El-Yahudiyeh ware juglet; wheel-made; cylindrical neck flaring slightly to rolled rim; vertical handle from below rim to shoulder; biconical body; button base; decorated with shallow incised horizontal line at maximum diameter; above and below are two rows of punctured chevrons around body; traces of highly lustrous burnishing; surface very dark grey, fabric light grey; handle worn and mended.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Enkomi
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (C102)
Murray, Smith and Walters 1900 / Excavations in Cyprus (p.6-7, Fig 8)
Kaplan 1980 / The Origin and Distribution of Tell el Yahudiyeh Ware. (P. 298, Fig. 87.a)
